headline.main: BRITISH SPUR TOIL ON U.S. MATERIAL; Train Mechanics to Maintain Planes From America in Top Fighting Trim

lead_paragraph: LONDON, Oct. 5 -- Although during the past three months something more than 10,000,000 tons of goods has been unloaded from ships in British ports, it is only within recent days that food, raw materials and finished goods from the United States under the lease-lend act have actually been arriving.
abstract: C Thompson articles on Brit receipt, distribution and use of lend-lease materials
